intro: Leptodactylon pungens subsp. eupungens, commonly known as the Pungent Leptodactylon, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed.
